meanings.definition: The act of imposing Soviet-style government and policies on a country or region.
meanings.sent1: The sovietization of the nation led to significant changes in its political structure.
meanings.sent2: After the sovietization, the country adopted new laws and regulations.
meanings.sent3: The sovietization of the small town made everyone wear red hats on Thursdays!
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was sovietization in action, enforcing strict rules and regulations.
meanings.sent5: The sovietization of the school was complete when all students started wearing uniforms and saluting the flag.

meanings.definition: The process of transforming a society to conform to the principles of Soviet communism.
meanings.sent1: The sovietization of the community brought about changes in the economic system.
meanings.sent2: During the sovietization, the emphasis shifted towards collective ownership.
meanings.sent3: The sovietization of the workplace meant everyone had to share their snacks at lunch!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas on equality were like a gentle sovietization of the company culture.
meanings.sent5: The sovietization of the neighborhood was evident in the uniformity of the apartment buildings.
